page.title: 08PORTHCAWL-The promenade
page.content: Over the last 50yrs,Porthcawl Promenade Beach has been eroded.We know from old postcards that the sand level was once as high as the old sea wall,but due to erosion this part of the coastline is known as "The Rocks" The gradient of the beach and the shape of the second sea wall caused waves to churn up sand from the bay. During high tides and storms the energy of the waves carried all this matter in suspension out to sea and the beach disappeared. In 1984 after research by Mr Marge of the Polytechnic of Wales,work was started to reshape the beach floor. The waves now disipate their energy as they run up the beach and deposit sand rather than remove it.The Promenade Beach is now returning.
